Given my new strategy to play a game to its fullest before giving my opinion on it, I'd say I've done that with Half Life 2. The game has a lot to offer, and I still haven't done everything there is to do, so many more play throughs are warranted. 

Some of the aspects I liked about the game include:

The Story
I love the story, and especially how its done in this game. Your goal to fight against a seemingly impossible force to save humanity, though cliche is very deserving in its execution. Especially with all the characters in the game, and how you learn the story throughout the game through indirect information is amazing.

Engine
The source engine has allowed for this game to live up to what I thought it was going to be. Just messing around with the physics props was some of the most entertaining things ever, and especially how well the engine allows for certain things like proper vehicle physics and explosives all work together perfectly.

It's kind of dumb to talk about this game at this point in history. You either like the Half Life series or you don't, but if you're just starting out with it, then know this.
This is not the sequel to Half Life you'd expect. This isn't the same type of game at all. It's an action adventure where you travel across the continent, and while I'm sure a lot of the setpieces and the game overall was impressive when it came out, it aged terribly. 
Where Half Life 1 is a solid shooter where you explore a single locale and puzzle out ways to beat encounters, Half Life 2 just throws shit at you constantly. It's fast paced, it's action packed, but it's not HALF LIFE. 
I'm not going to be continuing this series any further.

this game is a masterclass in world building

It's a big improvement over HL1.

Edit: 

This game is amazing! The levels were fun and I didn't die over and over just to get to another spot I will continuously die in. The challenge was still there and it didn't remove from the fun at all. I played both HL1 & HL2 on hard. HL1's hard mode was fun at times it would throw a situation at me where I had to restart so many times. HL2 fixes that issue. The only complaint I have was the bugs in the game. They weren't that bad, but it did have me restart a section sometimes. But overall, great game.

A somewhat poorly aged masterpiece. The story, action, and music are incredible to this day, but the gimmicky physics puzzles and uncomfortably apologetic AI can seem dated at times. The graphics have obviously not held up as well as the game's contemporaries, but the atmosphere of an unprepared world swiftly overturned by an alien force still stand out in the modern landscape.

absolutely recommend. very linear, solid puzzles, I did experience a bug where the dynamic lighting defaulted to just... very very bright. you'll know what it is when you see it, it starts on the chapter: black mesa east. to fix it, go into properties and under launch settings type: "mat_dxlevel 95 mat_hdr_level 2" that should fix it. otherwise, cool story. though I'm not too sure how one man is able to break into one of the citadels of a military that took down all of earth's militarys in seven hours, but whatever. love ravenholm, really cool chapter. I got this game on sale, but you should still buy at full price if you have the means.
